title: FBI Gives Update On Trump Assassination Bid, Rules Out Foreign Involvement
content: United States' Federal Bureau of Investigation or FBI, which is investigating the assassination attempt on Donald Trump at the Republican rally in Pennsylvania last month, has revealed that the gunman Thomas Crooks acted alone.
summary: United States' Federal Bureau of Investigation or FBI, which is investigating the assassination attempt on Donald Trump at the Republican rally in Pennsylvania last month, has revealed that the gunman Thomas Crooks acted alone.

title: Why US Political Culture Is Marked By Good Speeches But Bad Debates
content: The recent Democratic National Convention in Chicago was a showcase of impressive speeches.

title: Harris Faces "Major Test" With First Campaign Interview Ahead Of US Polls
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris will give her first interview Thursday since becoming the Democratic standard-bearer, after intense criticism from Republicans that she has been hiding from tough questions.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris will give her first interview Thursday since becoming the Democratic standard-bearer, after intense criticism from Republicans that she has been hiding from tough questions.

title: Kamala Harris Campaign Hires Arab Lawyer For Voter Outreach Amid Gaza War
content: Kamala Harris' campaign for US president has hired an Egyptian American lawyer and former Department of Homeland Security official to help lead outreach to Arab American voters who hold sway in some states that could help decide the Nov. 5 election
summary: Kamala Harris' campaign for US president has hired an Egyptian American lawyer and former Department of Homeland Security official to help lead outreach to Arab American voters who hold sway in some states that could help decide the Nov. 5 election

title: Major Glacial Lake Surveys In Arunachal, Sikkim Areas Bordering China
content: As a part of the national survey to preempt the Glacial Lake Outburst Flood (GLOF), the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) has started surveying the Eastern Himalayas to map all glacial lakes in the country.
summary: As a part of the national survey to preempt the Glacial Lake Outburst Flood (GLOF), the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) has started surveying the Eastern Himalayas to map all glacial lakes in the country.

title: Nations Building Their Own AI Models Add To Nvidia's Growing Chip Demand
content: Countries adopting their own AI applications and models will contribute about low double-digit billions to Nvidia's revenue in the financial year ending in January 2025, Nvidia forecasts
summary: Countries adopting their own AI applications and models will contribute about low double-digit billions to Nvidia's revenue in the financial year ending in January 2025, Nvidia forecasts

title: New Research Shows Microplastics Have Now Reached Our Brains
content: Plastic is in our clothes, cars, mobile phones, water bottles and food containers. But recent research adds to growing concerns about the impact of tiny plastic fragments on our health.
summary: Plastic is in our clothes, cars, mobile phones, water bottles and food containers. But recent research adds to growing concerns about the impact of tiny plastic fragments on our health.

title: Taylor Swift's Vienna Concert Attack Was Averted With US Intelligence Aid
content: Taylor Swift's three concerts in Vienna, part of her sold-out Eras Tour, were canceled in early August after authorities got word of the threats.
summary: Taylor Swift's three concerts in Vienna, part of her sold-out Eras Tour, were canceled in early August after authorities got word of the threats.

title: What Is Listeria, A Bacterial Infection That Has Lead To Sudden Deaths In US
content: The United States has reported over 58 cases in a Listeria outbreak, with eight deaths according to the latest data released by the US Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
summary: The United States has reported over 58 cases in a Listeria outbreak, with eight deaths according to the latest data released by the US Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

title: How This Mpox Outbreak Is Different, According To Experts
content: The World Health Organization declared the last mpox global emergency over in May 2023. And just over a year later, here we are again.

title: Nvidia Chief Says New Blackwell Chip Will Have 'Lots and Lots' Of Supply
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang, addressing concerns about the company's new Blackwell chips, said that supplies will be plentiful after manufacturing gains momentum.
summary: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang, addressing concerns about the company's new Blackwell chips, said that supplies will be plentiful after manufacturing gains momentum.

title: Fake X Accounts Push For Pro-Trump Content Using Stolen Pics Of Influencers
content: Meet "Eva," "Sophia," and "Samantha" -- fake accounts which pose as chic American women who support Donald Trump on the platform X, disguising themselves by using stolen photographs, according to a study published Wednesday.
summary: Meet "Eva," "Sophia," and "Samantha" -- fake accounts which pose as chic American women who support Donald Trump on the platform X, disguising themselves by using stolen photographs, according to a study published Wednesday.

title: Australian PMs Private Chat Caught On Camera In Awkward Summit Blooper
content: An unguarded exchange between Australia's prime minister and a veteran US diplomat about a sensitive Pacific policing plan was caught on camera, causing blushes at a regional summit Thursday.
summary: An unguarded exchange between Australia's prime minister and a veteran US diplomat about a sensitive Pacific policing plan was caught on camera, causing blushes at a regional summit Thursday.

title: US Reports More Illnesses, Deaths In Listeria Outbreak Linked To Deli Meat
content: The US has reported more than 50 illnesses and eight deaths in Listeria outbreak, according to the latest data released by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

title: South Korea Urges Telegram To Help Combat Digital Sex Crimes
content: South Korean authorities called on Telegram and other social media platforms on Wednesday to work together with them in deleting and blocking sexually explicit deepfake content, seeking to appease public and political outrage over the problem.
summary: South Korean authorities called on Telegram and other social media platforms on Wednesday to work together with them in deleting and blocking sexually explicit deepfake content, seeking to appease public and political outrage over the problem.

title: Trump Amplifies False Claims Against Kamala Harris' Veep Pick Tim Walz
content: A barrage of attacks on Tim Walz fueled by misinformation over his support for LGBTQ communities has failed to dent the US vice presidential candidate's surging poll ratings.
summary: A barrage of attacks on Tim Walz fueled by misinformation over his support for LGBTQ communities has failed to dent the US vice presidential candidate's surging poll ratings.

title: Australian TV Slammed As Pic Of "Sexy Santa" Dancers At Meeting Goes Viral
content: A local Australian news channel has come under fire after a video of a dancing group of "sexy Santas" emerged from what has been described as a routine staff meeting.
summary: A local Australian news channel has come under fire after a video of a dancing group of "sexy Santas" emerged from what has been described as a routine staff meeting.

title: South Korea Battery Maker Arrested Over Factory Fire That Killed 23
content: The CEO of a South Korean lithium battery maker has been arrested over a factory fire that killed 23 people in June, a local court told AFP Thursday.
summary: The CEO of a South Korean lithium battery maker has been arrested over a factory fire that killed 23 people in June, a local court told AFP Thursday.

title: Canada Is Now Among World's Top 4 Greenhouse Gas Emitters Due To Wildfires
content: Record wildfires in 2023 bumped Canada into the top four greenhouse gas-emitting countries in the world that year, according to a study Wednesday that also cast doubt on its forests' future ability to capture and store significant amounts of CO2.
summary: Record wildfires in 2023 bumped Canada into the top four greenhouse gas-emitting countries in the world that year, according to a study Wednesday that also cast doubt on its forests' future ability to capture and store significant amounts of CO2.
